meanings.definition: The act of docking a ship at a quay.
meanings.sent1: The quayages of the ship were done carefully to avoid any damage.
meanings.sent2: The quayages for large vessels can be quite challenging due to their size.
meanings.sent3: The captain joked that his quayages skills were so good, he could dock blindfolded.
meanings.sent4: Her precision in quayages was like a skilled dancer gracefully moving across the stage.
meanings.sent5: The quayages of the massive cruise ship left a lasting impression on the spectators.

meanings.sent1: The quayages for unloading cargo included additional fees for overtime.
meanings.sent2: The company had to budget for the quayages to ensure smooth operations.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected increase in quayages caused a stir among the shipping companies.
meanings.sent4: The quayages seemed like a toll booth for ships entering the harbor.
meanings.sent5: The quayages were a necessary expense for the business to continue its operations.

meanings.definition: The area of a quay where ships are moored.
meanings.sent1: The quayages were bustling with activity as ships arrived and departed.
meanings.sent2: The workers ensured the quayages were kept clear for incoming vessels.
meanings.sent3: The seagulls perched on the quayages, watching the ships come and go.
meanings.sent4: The quayages resembled a busy parking lot for boats of all sizes.
meanings.sent5: The lights along the quayages guided the ships safely to their berths.
